Check out men style guide, grooming and health advise tips for cosmopolitan men Thu, 12 May 2016 17:34:01 +0000 en hourly 1 http://www.mensxp.com http://www.mensxp.comhttp://mensxp.com/logo.jpgwww.mensxp.com<![CDATA[Heres All The Hype Around Friday The 13th That You Need To Hear Today ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:55:46 +0000Dessidre Fleminghttp://www.mensxp.com/special-features/today/30610-here-s-all-the-hype-around-friday-the-13th-that-you-need-to-hear-today.html

]]>Guess what the day is?

It’s Friday, yes. But, it’s also the 13th. Put the two together and you get Friday the 13th—the one day that has gone down in history and folklore to be named as one of the unluckiest days, ever. So unlucky has this one particular date become that we now associate it with a phobia!

Yes.

Question: What is the fear of Friday the 13th called?

Answer: Paraskevidekatriaphobia.

Yes, that’s a word. Try and Google it.

© Dogonews

So what’s the deal with Friday the 13th?

Strangely, there is no hard evidence to support that Friday the 13th is indeed inauspicious. All stories rely on hearsay. But, here’s a little backgrounder on all things Friday the 13th because we still want to spook you out.

While there is a lot to support in the inauspiciousness of the number 13 and the day Friday, individually; as a collective, stories never really stemmed before the 19th century. 

According to one theory, the date is considered unlucky because of it being the day that Jesus Christ was crucified, according to the Bible. However, there is no significance of 13 in that. Unless, you count the Last Supper which Jesus Christ is said to have had with his disciples, when Judas Escariot was the 13th one who came later. This has become basis for another folklore that says if you dine with 13 people in total, one of the 13 die within a year.

© Wikipedia

The next theory has to do with the fact that on October 13th 1989, Wall Street took a hit in what was its second large drop of the Dow Jones Industrial Average in history. It was later nicknamed as the ‘Friday the 13th mini-crash’.

© Huffington Post

Another theory goes something like this: According to The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown, on this inauspicious day, the church had ordered the arrest and thereafter, slaughtering of the Knights Templar. According to some historical findings, it just so happens to be that the Grand Master of the Knights 

Templar, Jacques de Molay, was indeed arrested on 13th October 1307, which was a Friday.

© Theknightstemplar

Over time, folklore has grown bigger than fact, and people have come to believe the heresy over the honest truth. Whatever may be the case, we still do have reason to fear Friday the 13th. Why?

Remember the Friday the 13th movie franchise that had a certain eerily-masked impossible-to-kill murderer named Jason Voorhees who goes around slashing the teenage campers’ throats, guts and intestines in lonely forests, murky lakes and shambled houses? Yeah.

© Crystal Lake Entertainment

Add to that, the following sayings:

1. Never cut your hair on Friday the 13th or a loved one will die.

2. A child born on Friday the 13th is unlucky for life.

3. If a funeral procession passes you on Friday the 13th, you will die next (Jason Voorhees was probably responsible anyway).

And countless others, too. Just ask your mothers and they’ll probably give you pointers to add to the list. I’m sure they’ve even met Jason Voorhees at some point and survived to tell the tale (yeah, right).

Anyhow, good luck getting through Friday the 13th and making it out on the other side, alive and kicking. I’ll see you there… or not. Who knows? I got the Paraskevidekatriaphobia and will probably just lock myself in a danger-proofed room.

Buh-bye!

]]><![CDATA[This Is What It Really Feels Like To Be The One Who Breaks Someones Heart ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:40:30 +0000Rimi Chakrabortyhttp://www.mensxp.com/relationships/break-ups/30609-this-is-what-it-really-feels-like-to-be-the-one-who-breaks-someone-s-heart.html

]]>Heartbreakers are generally considered heartless. They don’t know how to love someone. They only know how to play with a girl’s heart and move on. You might even hear jokes about heartbreakers living with huge jars of broken hearts.

Well guess what, one can never know how it feels to be a heartbreaker unless they have been there. Sorry to disappoint you folks but at some point you too have been in the shoes of a heartbreaker, it’s just that you never realized it.

Imagine you propose to a girl and she rejects you, you are hurt and you feel the pain. However, on the other hand, let’s suppose a girl likes you and confesses her feelings to you. But you like someone else and you decline her advances. The girl cries and curses you for breaking her heart. So now you have actually experienced both the roles, would you still say you broke someone’s heart? Or you would say that you are a broken-hearted person.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

You will find tons of stories and advice for heartbroken people, but hardly anyone ever talks about the other side of the coin; i.e. the heartbreaker. We have somehow grown to sympathize with the broken-hearted and have immense anger for the ones who break it. But no one really knows what it feels like to be a heartbreaker. While we term them as assholes who only know how to play with others’ hearts, we never really understand what goes on in their minds. Here is what a heartbreaker feels and what others never seem to understand.

I Feel Sorry For You But Not For Leaving You

Just like we said the stories or views of heartbreakers are never shared, so we never care about them and heal our heartbroken friends, which is perfectly fine. But heartbreakers also feel sorry for breaking your heart, for knowing that they would inflict pain but still choose to do so.

I Don’t Love You Anymore

You guys might not agree with me but just like it’s easy to love someone, it’s equally easy to fall out of love. So if we don’t feel for you the same way we used to, there is nothing wrong in that. We feel the pain too and we don’t find any joy in breaking your heart. Yet we would be tagged as emotionless jerks.    

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

I Am NOT Breaking Up For Fun

When we decide to break up, we know it’s going to hurt the other person terribly but we too are going to feel like shit. Would you stay with the person for the sake of your relationship or would you leave that person for the betterment of both? Which is better – breakup or a loveless relationship?

I Get The Pain But I Also Know That It’s The Right Thing To Do

While we randomly go around cursing our exes, somewhere we are thankful to them too for making us stronger on the emotional front. It’s not like heartbreakers are emotionless sadists. They know it’s for good. P.S. we are not counting cheaters here.   

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Even I Have Mixed Emotions About Our Broken Relationship

Heartbreakers no doubt hold 100% accountability when your heart is broken. But even then we feel the pain and reminisce the moments spent with you. In fact, sometimes we might even fantasize about our relationship had we been together.

Even I Feel Devastated And Damaged   

We never intend on breaking your heart. We know we shared a lot of memories, we loved each other and we cared for each other too. But when things don’t work out someone has to end it. We don’t take your love lightly, sometimes we cry too since it killed us for hurting you.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

I like You But I Don’t love You

Not just relationships, even in terms of dating sometimes we just don’t feel the same way as you do. We might like your company but that’s not enough for building a healthy and strong relationship. When you don’t love her you can’t afford to beat around the bush or sweet talk with her. You have to tell her it won’t work.

So guys we know that being heartbroken is worse and not to forget one of the painful things in the world. But being a heartbreaker is not merrier. The struggles a heartbreaker goes through and yet always gets cursed for what he did is disheartening.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

]]><![CDATA[15 Everyday Things That Annoy The Hell Out Of People ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:29:16 +0000Harshleen Anandhttp://www.mensxp.com/special-features/today/30608-15-everyday-things-that-annoy-the-hell-out-of-people.html

]]>Being a human requires more than breathing and eating food for survival. Today, patience and calmness are virtues that few people manage to acquire. People get infuriated at the drop of a hat, patience levels are lower than the basement of our buildings and to top it, there are these itsy bitsy tiny things that people around us do, or that the universe conspires to be done, which annoy the hell out of us. Know that feeling?  Well here are 15 such instances which annoy us more than anything else in the world:

1. National Holiday On A Sunday

You could be a school or a college student, an employee in an MNC or a CEO of your own company, but who does NOT like free holidays? The beauty of being an Indian is the fact that we have so many festivals and so many lovely holidays. Our family outings, our vacations, even weddings are planned around them. If a national holiday happens to fall on a Sunday, we curse the hell out of the species who created this calendar in the first place! Not to forget how it annoys you.

2. Colleagues Who Don’t Smile Often

So you just passed a vague smile to your colleagues while walking up to your seat, not to forget that it was already half hearted maybe, but they just reply with a ‘hey’ without even looking up from their screen. How many muscles does a human require to do the most basic thing in the world? You spend the entire day together, might as well start it on a ‘smiling’ note, no? K.

3.  Uber Surge Pricing

Travelling in the Delhi traffic is already a major pain in head, and our CM recently gifted us with the odd-even scheme which became a profit making machine for taxi providers. Please tell me why am I paying 4 times the fare price to go back to my own house? It’s my home, not a flight to Goa that I am paying for. Duh!

4. People Who Put Empty Bottles Back In The Fridge

You drank that last drop of the coke, you drank all the water from that bottle, I get it. But then you lost me at the point when you had the guts to put the empty bottle back in the fridge. Is it a magic refillable bottle? Or are you trying to be Satan’s angel? I can’t decide, anyways too late. I hate you now.

5. Metro And Local Train Woes

Don’t even get me started on it. People staring at you until you give up your seat, people stepping on your toe in a stampede like a bomb just blasted and they are running for their lives, people who will not stand away from the door when your station arrives. Travelling in your city’s local train is fool proof recipe to ruin your day, even before it started.

6. The Weather

The sun rays are currently piercing through our skin and our cars are like over heated ovens. Tell me how does that make anyone of us smile?

7. Relatives Asking About Your Marriage

This one is synonymous with everyone. Your annoying relatives asking you about your marriage constantly like the entire humanity’s survival depended on your wedding! Why?

8. Paying For 4G And Not Even Getting 2G

You signed up for 4G thinking the internet on your phone was now sorted and you don’t even mind paying those extra bucks for the service. The result? Leave alone 4G, the horrendous service providers nab us of any signal on our phones! Sometimes we are even unable to make a call or use 2G on the handset. If you call the customer care, they’ll be like “your call is very important for us, please continue to hold”. Thank you boiling our blood.

9. Wailing kids in a cinema hall

Are you on a movie date, sneakily holding hands, whispering sweet nothings to each other, or enjoying your popcorn with your family in the theatre? Well, there are these little devils whose parents come to cinema halls with just one aim: we are raising them back home, here, enjoy their wailing for the next three hours while we unapologetically ruin your experience. The kids have a talent of shouting, running and crying during the most intense scenes usually. Just saying, not annoying at all, yeah right.

10. A Non Functioning Wi-Fi Router

The entire universe will conspire and snatch away any remote signal from your router while you try to download that much awaited ‘Game Of Thrones’ episode, or a good flick for your weekend night in bed. It will continue acting pricy until your mood is ruined and you have given up hope. Wait, it will ‘magically’ work when you go on Facebook and end up reading spoilers. Oops. Patience tested!

11. Random Skin Breakout Before A Big Day

You slept like a sane human, all excited for something big the next day, but what happened actually? Your sebum glands decided to work over time and you woke up in the morning with a break out. Ouch. Day ruined, mood super ruined. You end up hating everything and everyone that day.

12. Extra Smart Towel Dispensers At Work

Whatever happened to the traditional tissue paper holders in the washrooms? I don’t want to gauge my way through a mechanical roll of paper and up with tissues glued to my wet palms. So FREAKING annoying.

13. When Siri Won’t Understand Or Answer Our Questions

You already paid a lot of money on that freaking iPhone, the least that Siri can do is answer the Goddamn question and not Google the shit out of our innocent queries.

14. Drunk Friends Ranting

There are always these people in your group who will kill your buzz because they need dragging, they need your shoulder and basically they need you to adopt them for a while because they are way too drunk to even blink. If you don’t drink at all and have to be a witness to this drama, then what can I say? May God bless you with more patience.

15. Humans In General

This one hardly needs any more explanation. Sometimes the breathing sound of a human you despise is enough to annoy you. That is all it takes.  We as humans need to apologise to everyone whom we have not annoyed yet, because, please be patient. We will get to you shortly.

]]><![CDATA[The Extraordinary Story Of The Richest Indian Man That Ever Lived ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:17:37 +0000Shantanu Prasherhttp://www.mensxp.com/special-features/today/30606-the-extraordinary-story-of-the-richest-indian-man-that-ever-lived.html

]]>The legend has it that he was so rich that he tried to buy Goa from the Portuguese. His collection of diamonds and pearls could fill up not one, but multiple Olympic-sized swimming pools. In 1940, he was worth two percent of the entire economy of the United States Of America. This is the story of the 7th Nizam of Hyderabad Osman Ali Khan, Asaf Jah VII, or better said, the ‘richest Indian to ever exist in documented history’.

© Wikimedia

Born on 6th April 1886, Osman Ali Khan grew up to become the 7th and the last Nizam of Hyderabad. He will always be remembered for the baffling amount of wealth he accumulated during his reign from 1911-1948.  He appeared on the cover of Time magazine in 1937, branded as the ‘Richest Man On Earth’. Time magazine also reported that he had his own mint, printing his own currency, the ‘Hyderabadi Rupee’. He also used the Jacob Diamond, the fifth largest in the world, worth 100 million pounds as his paperweight.

© Wikimedia

Time magazine on Feb 22, 1937 reported –

“Most news stories hung on the Richest Man are chiefly chatter about how careful His Exalted Highness is with his pennies — whereas $5,000 is his approximate daily income, his jewels have an estimated value of $150,000,000, he reputedly has salted down $250,000,000 in gold bars and his capital totals some $1,400,000,000, not to mention the fabled “Mines of Golconda. The cash Silver Jubilee gifts to the Nizam of Hyderabad, by his subjects were expected this week to total at least $1,000,000.”

© Wikimedia

While a lot of scattered sources on the internet report his net worth to be around $230 billion, his dedicated Wikipedia page quotes his net worth to be $2 billion in the early 1940s ($33.8 billion today) or 2 per cent of the US economy then. In 1940, the treasury of the newly independent Union government of India reported annual revenue of $1 billion. Under his rule, he patronised education, science and development. He also introduced electricity, railways, roads and airways. His collection of jewels alone was valued at approximately $500 million. His palace had 6,000 staffers and 38 people were engaged to just clean the chandeliers alone.

© Wikimedia

Osman Ali had at least 34 children and a baffling 104 grandchildren. By 1990, over 400 people showed up as claimants to his massive wealth. The Indian Government finally annexed the state of Hyderabad in 1948 and the Nizam signed his wealth over to his grandson Prince Mukarram Jah. While all the wealth of the Nizam was being seized by the Indian government, the Nizam made a transfer of 1 million pounds in NatWest Bank in London in the name of his grandson, Mukarram Jah. The British government converted that huge sum of money into war bonds and eventually turned it into a fixed income deposit, forever. Mukarram Jah lives a life of ruins as he never received his inheritance.

© Wikimedia

© Wikimedia

Source: TIME magazine report dated Feb 22, 1937

]]><![CDATA[12 Simple Ways To Get Rid Of Dark Underarm Skin ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:01:58 +0000Ankush Bahugunahttp://www.mensxp.com/grooming/personal-hygiene/30605-12-simple-ways-to-get-rid-of-dark-underarm-skin.html

]]>One of the least discussed and most neglected aspects of personal hygiene, especially when it comes to men, your underarm skin needs as much care as your face, hair and beard! A lot of men avoid sporting tank tops and vests because of that ugly dark patch under their arms. A dirty armpit is the biggest turn off there can be in a man, honestly. So, read on as we tell you 12 simple ways you can keep your underarms fresh and clean.

1. Grate a slice of potato and extract the juice. Apply it on your armpits and let it dry for 10 minutes. Rinse. Repeat this every day.

2. Extract cucumber juice. Add some lemon squeeze and turmeric powder to it. Apply that paste. Wash after half an hour.

3. Rub a slice of lemon on your armpits twice a day. Lemon makes the skin lighter and kills germs. But excessive use of lemon juice can also dry up your skin. So, do follow it up with a moisturizer every time.

© Shutterstock

4. Due to lack of personal hygiene, dead skin cells accumulate making the skin appear darker. Exfoliate it every day using a mix of brown sugar and virgin olive oil.

5. You can also use pumice stone to remove the dead skin cells, but don’t go too rough as the underarm skin can be sensitive to abrasions.

6. Make a paste of milk, rose water and dried orange peel powder and leave the paste on for about 20 minutes.

© Shutterstock

7. You can also use a bleaching agent to make your armpit skin lighter in appearance by mixing baking soda with rose water.

8. Apply coconut oil on your armpits before bathing. The Vitamin E will help lighten the skin.

9. A thick paste of gram flour and yogurt also works wonders.

© Shutterstock

10. Avoid using deodorants directly onto your underarms. It causes darkening of skin.

11. Shaving or trimming doesn’t remove underarm hair completely which makes them look darker than the rest of your body. If waxing hurts too much, use a hair removal cream after you’ve shaved or trimmed your underarm hair.

12. Wear the right kind of clothes. It is summers and the friction caused between your skin and the fabric might just add to the darkening, along with sweating. Wear loose, comfortable clothes that let your skin breathe.

© Shutterstock

]]><![CDATA[8 Common Skincare Myths You Probably Thought Were True ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:49:19 +0000Aksheev Purihttp://www.mensxp.com/grooming/skin-care/30602-8-common-skincare-myths-you-probably-thought-were-true.html

]]>Dudes are usually ignorant when it comes to skin care and the truth of the matter is that they hardly pay any attention to how their skin is turning out to be or how it is reacting to different situations. Even if some of us do care about our skin, we hardly know the correct measures to care for it.

We generally tend to take some kind of “word of mouth” advice and go ahead with applying that advice on our skin which can be really harmful and can back fire. Each skin type is different and there needs to specific expert attention given to it. An advice given to you by your friend doesn’t necessarily go well with your skin. We suggest you stop believing in the myths you hear around and focus on the truth with these 8 common skincare tips.

Myth – Fairness Creams Will Make Your Skin Fairer

© YouTube

Truth – Seriously? Did you actually get trapped in this big marketing gimmick? We thought so! Not only fairness creams send a bad social message, they also do not make you any fairer. These creams just remove pigmentation and even out the discoloured skin. If you go by our advice, we reckon you to not worry about the colour of your skin and be just as confident with it. Whiter is not necessarily better.

Myth – Higher The SPF In A Sunscreen, Higher Is The Sun Protection

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – There are three types of UV rays – UVA, UVB and UVC. UVA is the most harmful penetrating your skin deeply causing a tan. UVB rays cause normal sunburns and UVC rays get absorbed by the atmosphere meaning they do not reach the ground. The SPF on a sunscreen means the amount of protection it provides from UVB rays and most sunscreens just cover UVB rays and not UVA. Broad spectrum on a sunscreen means that it provides protection from both UVA and UVB. We suggest you go for a broad spectrum sunscreen with SPF of at least 15 with one of the following chemicals - mexoryl, oxybenzone or avobenzone.

Myth – You Don’t Need Sunscreen On A Cloudy Day

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – The sun rays do reach the earth surface even on a cloudy day. Do not get this wrong and apply your sun screen as you would usually on a sunny day because you always want to be protected.

Myth – Drinking Water Will Hydrate Your Skin

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – You have heard it a zillion times that drinking a lot of water will keep your skin hydrated but it’s not totally correct. Drinking water is generally very healthy for our body but its co-relation with skin is untrue. Our skin is hydrated either by naturally producing oils or with the help of moisturizers and skin lotions. Now you know what to do if you want to care for your dry skin.

Myth – You Don’t Need To Moisturize Oil Skin Type

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – If you have oily skin, you know what we exactly mean. Oily skin types, just like dry and combination, needs to be moisturized on a daily basis. If you tend to over wash or leave oily skin un-moisturized, they become too dry producing more sebum because of lack of moisture leading to breakouts in your skin.

Myth – Your Skin Is Less Irritable To Natural Remedies Than Chemical Ones

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – Sure natural ingredients have a lot of benefits attached to them but using them on your skin can be dangerous for people with sensitive skins. While chemicals are treated in the labs under expert supervision to deal with our skin, natural products, because they are directly taken from plants react differently to different skin types.

Myth – Drinking Milk Makes Your Skin White

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – While you have been told about this “ritual” since you were a kid and even now that drinking milk will make your skin white and smooth but this co-relation is not at all true. In fact, skin experts claim that humans shouldn’t drink animal milk after two years of birth i.e. infancy. We wonder what we have been taught all this while.

Myth – Scrubbing Removes Blackheads

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Truth – We usually become the experts ourselves and go on to give out advices like these which are absolutely untrue. Blackheads are rooted deep inside the pores of your skin which cannot be removed by scrubbing alone. We just tend to scrub out the outer layer of the blackhead which grows back again next to the blackhead you just removed. Next time, go to a skin expert to get your blackheads removed and not on your own.

]]><![CDATA[Are You Called Rude For Not Listening When You Are Busy With You Smartphone? Guess What Its Not Your Fault ]]>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:06:06 +0000Rimi Chakrabortyhttp://www.mensxp.com/health/health-conditions/30600-are-you-called-rude-for-not-listening-when-you-are-busy-with-you-smartphone-guess-what-it-s-not-your-fault.html

]]>Raise your hands if you are going to show this first thing to your parents, friends and colleagues!

Imagine your mom asks you to get something while you were immersed in your smartphone. Five minutes later, she comes over, slaps you or scolds you and takes away your phone for not listening to her. And all you have to say in defense was that you didn’t know she said something. Does this situation sound similar to you?  Trust us guys, it is a common phenomenon and happens with us all the time.

What’s hard is we blame ourselves for not listening and go on a guilt trip for screwing up. Well, don’t blame yourselves or your phone for this phenomenon.

A new study reveals that when you are busy with your smartphone or doing any other taxing visual task, you won’t be able to hear what others are saying or any background sound. This research has been published in the Journal of Neurosciences and this hearing deficit is being called Inattentional Deafness http://www.jneurosci.org/content/35/49/16046.abstract .

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

So technically this might not be your fault if you couldn’t hear what your mom asked you to get, or when you skipped your station because you were too engrossed in your book.  

This study was approved by the University College London Research Ethics Committee and more than 10 people participated in it. According to their experiment, when the participants were subjected to difficult visuals tasks, there was a reduction in brain’s response to the background sound. 

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Sometimes people might think you are ignoring them. In fact, if your friend doesn’t listen to you while using his laptop, don’t get him wrong. They might not even know what you are talking about.

Interestingly, the findings of this research also suggest that our vision and hearing skills share limited resources in the brain. In other words, our brain cannot do visual and hearing things at the same time. So when we are doing any visual tasks, our brain has to choose between processing information from our eyes or ears.

Thanks brain, for screwing up our lives! But at least now we have a reason to sympathize with ourselves.

]]>More muscle mass, lower body fat and sturdy bones are some of the most visible indicators of higher testosterone levels. If you are fat around the waist, have weak muscles and bones, then your t-levels are low and you should be doing something about it ASAP!

]]>Doesn’t it feel oddly satisfying when you know someone’s lying but you listen to their story anyway, just to see how far they’d go? These 10 signs will help you look through anyone who’s trying to take you for a ride!

1. They give out too much information. They reveal details that are completely unnecessary and irrelevant to the main plot. It’s probably their way of overcompensating for the lie.

2. They parrot a set of phrases or words multiple times in the same conversation. Their dialogue seems rehearsed. They fear getting caught so they tend to fall back on the part they’re the most confident about.

3. They make ambiguous statements that don’t really reveal anything. They don’t answer your questions directly. They twist them around and beat around the bush and steer away from the main subject.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

4. We involuntarily cover our mouth when we’re lying, even if just for a second. So, if you find someone touching their face or placing their hand over their lips, there’s a good chance they’re bluffing.

5. Look for their body language. A man who has nothing to fear about will be relaxed. Someone who is lying would probably sit with their arms crossed against their chest, as if trying to hide something.

6. Shuffling feet is the most obvious one. It shows that the person is on the edge and the nervousness is building up.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

7. It is said that someone who is lying would avoid eye contact at all means. Look for their gaze. Does it shift around too often? Are they blinking in a weird way? Are they trying to look away every time you look at them?

8. If you’re a good observer, you can almost always spot the nervousness on a liar’s face. There’s something odd. They smile weirdly, their lips quiver a lot, and their eyebrows twitch. If you’ve known the person for long, it wouldn’t be difficult to identify these signs.

9. Notice how their body reacts when you ask them a tricky question. When a person is about to lie, they make an involuntary head jerk.

10. Heavy breathing is another common sign. Look at their shoulders. If their breathing pattern changes, you’ll see their shoulders rising and the tension in their voice will be much noticeable.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

]]>My earliest memory of Parikrama involves a day spent in the campus of St. Columba’s School, New Delhi, back in 2011. Sitting in an audience of school kids, I had my first Indian Rock moment and it was like an epiphany! That’s the word I would use to describe Parikrama—an epiphany that started 25 years ago.

© Facebook

“It’s been a great journey,” Subir Mallik, the organist of the group says as we sit down to reminisce about the b(r)and’s evolution since its inception (Yes, they ARE a brand). Subir recounts the initial days of the band and how they started out over two decades ago. “It all started when a bunch of like-minded people got together with an aim to create music,” he tells me. “Back then, no one was doing good English rock music in India and we wanted to give people something authentic and homegrown.” Their first concert ever happened back in 1991 at the ever popular Father Agnel School event, titled Bandstand. Soon after, they became a favourite at college fests and concerts, and Parikrama spread across the country like a wildfire.

© The Official Gig

With all the increasing adoration and accolades that the band received, it would seem only obvious that the next thing in their agenda would be to release an album. But they didn’t. “At that time, no one really believed in the concept of CDs and cassettes, to be honest. And we wanted to give our audiences a complete experience, without making them have to buy our music in order to listen to it. Money was never the motive behind our music,” Subir informs.

Parikrama, as a whole, has never limited their music rights to any kind of privilege and have, therefore, made their music available for download to all their fans and every ardent music lover. But how does that work out for the band in a world where everybody wants to make money off everything they possibly can? “For us, music was never a means to an end,” Subir explains. “When we are up there performing, we are doing it for the joy of the music. We’re just a bunch of guys who love music and want to make the most of it.”

© Myopusradio

Parikrama composed their first song, titled Xerox, that came to be known as the ‘face of Indian rock’ music. In 1995, the band released their first single, Till I’m No One Again, along with Open Skies, as part of The Great Indian Rock, Part – 1. One year later, Parikrama came out with But It Rained, a song dedicated to the Kashmir Valley kidnappings that happened around the same time, which went on to be named as one of the band’s biggest hits, ever. One of the major highlights from the band remains their opening act for the Iron Maiden concert in Bangalore, India where they wowed, not just a crowd of 40,000 people who even sang along when the band played ‘But It Rained’, but went on to impress Rod Smallwood, Iron Maiden’s Manager with their performances. Subir recalls how the international iconic rock band later joined them in their green room to praise Parikrama’s music. “It was such a magical moment for us; to be in the presence of those guys,” Subir says.

© Hard Rock Cafe Mumbai

Now, it’s 2016 and the band is still as strong as ever. Older, yes. Experienced, yes. Evolved, in a way, yes. That’s Parikrama. The band has stayed true to their originality that made them into the phenomenon any rock band would aspire to be. And it all happened out of a genuine love for music; not a thirst for fame, or fortune. Maybe that’s a lesson for most modern musicians. Maybe too many artists have sold their souls to the devils of commercialism, just to make it big. “I think it’s more than that,” Subir says. “I think today, it has become important to look at music and artists as a lucrative profession. The industry has grown over time and we have new musicians, genres coming up every day. So why not?” The band today collaborates with younger artists to produce newer and more original music at live shows. “We love to team up with other artists and create new music. The point is to have fun on the stage and do what you love,” Subir says.

And that’s exactly what Parikrama has been doing for the past 25 years—what they love. To many, the band is old and repetitive. But, that is exactly why we need Parikrama around even after 25 years. We need to be reminded of the music of the old. We need to be reminded constantly of where we came from, where we are at and where we are headed.

Yes, it’s been 25 years since Parikrama came to be. 25 years down the line, Parikrama still is. 25 years from now, Parikrama will live on as the Indian rock legends we lived amongst; as the legends who created what we know now to be Indie rock.

© Hard Rock Cafe Mumbai

Congrats on turning 25, Parikrama. Unlike your track, you can never be No One again.

Here’s to many more 25s!

]]>Blame it on the ‘aesthetics chasing’ bodybuilding generation, a lot of workouts that actually build crazy strength are often overlooked. One of these ignored strength workouts is the ‘load carry’. If you have hit a strength-training plateau, then load carry, if done the right way, can prove to be really effective. Here’s what you need to know and how to program load carries in your training. 

© crossfit

Understand Load Carries

Anatomically, the human body is meant for lifting and carrying weights. But blame it on our lifestyle that we make every choice so that we can actually avoid carrying weights. Load carry helps put on muscle, boost overall physical strength, and fire up metabolism. Most important, grip, arm and core strength can be highly optimized doing the carries.  

Breaking Down The Types Of ‘Carries’

Pick up weights and move. Yes, it’s that simple but here, let me break down the load carry into 5 most effective variations so you can have a clear understanding.

1) Farmer’s Walk

© roguefitness

One of the most effective of all, Farmer’s Walk puts your arm strength to test. Pick up 2 dumbbells each weighing half of your bodyweight and walk as far as you can. Repeat till the time your shoulders and arms give up.

2) Yoke Carry

© boxmag

The ‘Yoke’ is an equipment that’s especially made for ‘load carry’. Speaking of form, the yoke carry allows you to carry the most weight as your entire body is lifting the weight and not only the hands, back or shoulder. The entire body is put to work. If you don’t have access to a Yoke, use a barbell across your back.

3) Over Head Weight Carry (Barbell/Dumbbell)

© crossfit

Lift a barbell, as heavy as you can, over your head and walk. The strength gained from this will directly reflect in your ‘cleans’ and ‘jerks’.

4) Duck Walk

© muscleandfitness

Hold the object in front of your legs and walk as far as possible. The move will take toll on your deltoids and forearms. Use a keg or an LPG cylinder.

5) Fireman’s Carry/Sandbag Carry

© crossfit

Lift a person on your shoulders and carry him as far as you can. This is actually the ultimate test of your strength and is most applicable in real life. Use a sand bag if your training partner isn’t ready to be carried!

How To Include It In Your Training      

1 Always carry heavy weight. The heavier the weight the more work your muscles would have to put in.

2 To make it more challenging, try carrying different weights in both hands.

3 Distance you walk must be increased every time you do ‘carries’.

4 Try incorporating it as a finisher on the days you train your shoulders.

]]>When we say these facts are weird, we are nowhere close to joking. When it comes to health, some aspects are crystal clear but some facts are so tricky that you won’t believe them to be true. Here we are talking about those weird health facts that actually make sense.

Avoid Antibacterial Soaps To Prevent Illness

Just because any soap reads antibacterial, can you completely rely on them to fight germs? The truth is, it might not necessarily protect you from illness, and nor would it prevent you from passing it on to others. According to a study by FDA, few ingredients of the soap might expose you to hormonal changes and health risks.     

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Diet Soda Does Not Help You Lose Weight

Sorry to crush your hopes guys, but drinking diet soda is not really helping. Eating sugar helps our bodies register the sweetness and work on the calorie intake, but the artificial sweeteners might trick our bodies into eating more and eventually lead to weight gain.

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Avoid Energy Drinks When Tired

The common ingredients found in most energy drinks are Taurine and Caffeine. When both these ingredients come together, the former actually blunts the impact of the latter. In fact, some studies suggest that Taurine also activates some receptors that decrease mental alertness. 

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Coffee Can Help You Take A Better Nap

Confused? Well, our brain has a chemical compound named Adenosine that slows down brain’s activity and makes us feel sleepy. We also know that caffeine restores alertness. So when you sip coffee prior to a 20-minute nap, the adenosine gets cleared naturally in our sleep and we wake up feeling refreshed.

© pixabay

Clean Your Mustache And Beard Regularly To Avoid Allergies Or Sneezes

Just like your clothes and skin, your mustache and beard too come in contact with germs and dust. These germs make you fall sick or sneeze constantly, so it becomes important to keep your beard clean all the time. Ideally wash your facial hair twice with soap daily, or trim or shave them at regular intervals.  

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

To Stop A Migraine, Sniff An Apple

Guess an apple not just keeps your doctor away, but it also keeps migraine away. Research suggests that the smell of green apple reduces the symptoms of migraine and shortens the impact of migraine too. So whenever you get a severe headache, cut a green apple in half and smell it.

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

Yet after all this insanity, Depp says that he was “very responsible” and did justice to the role. According to us, justice sure was served but responsible; now that’s questionable.   

1.Robert De Niro – Cape Fear

 To pull off the look of psychotic Max Cady, De Niro paid thousands of dollars to grind his teeth down. That’s right! Grind his teeth. He even left behind creepy messages as Cady on Scorsese’s answering machine to freak him out.

People might say that they are slaves to their art. But these guys lost a little bit of themselves to their characters.

]]>It’s been almost a year since Duncan Fletcher’s tenure ended with the Indian cricket team as a full-time coach and Ravi Shastri took over the reins. Although Shastri was never appointed as a coach, he might be the only option left for BCCI if the ongoing trend of celeb cricketers and coaches refusing the top-job continues.

Right now, it’s not even about getting the best person for the job because not many people are interested for a long-term commitment, especially when top leagues are offering good money without much accountability of performances.

© BCCL

The current BCCI secretary Anurag Thakur who constituted an advisory committee for coach selection in May last year had said then, "Good things come to those who wait. We are in the process of finalizing that in the cricket advisory committee and also short listing the name of the coaches who are available for the interview. Once that process is completed we will be in a position to take a final call to select the coach." But it’s been almost a year and nothing’s come off it yet.

A few names have been tossed around for some time now, including the Kiwi duo of Stephen Fleming and Daniel Vettori, former Australian captain Ricky Pointing and even India U-19 coach Rahul Dravid. But even though some of these former players might actually be interested in the job (Stephen Fleming and Dravid), they too have some doubts regarding the hectic travel schedule and the humungous responsibility which comes along with the top-job in cricket.

© BCCL

One of the main reasons why BCCI is finding it difficult to get the perfect man for the job is because of different leagues that have come up in the past three-four years. With the advent of Caribbean Premier League, Big Bash, Ram Slam and recently PCL, former coaches and players are spoilt for choice without having to commit for a longer period of time. This in turn also makes them a little picky when taking on high-octane assignments which can make or break their careers. 

For the time being, it seems, BCCI will make do with Ravi Shastri because finalizing a candidate when the BCCI president has himself resigned is a big task. And in some time, he might just be the only candidate left standing because he’s not doing too bad a job of coaching team India, right?

]]><![CDATA[18 Truths About People You Learn When You Grow Up ]]>Wed, 11 May 2016 16:21:03 +0000Ankush Bahugunahttp://www.mensxp.com/special-features/today/30575-18-truths-about-people-you-learn-when-you-grow-up.html

]]>Growing up, you often realize most of those childhood learnings didn’t mean anything. People are nothing like they seem to be. Life would be so much easier if only we could accept these truths.

1. You may think life is particularly difficult for you. But the truth is everyone has their own struggles. We all have our own share of deep sorrows hidden somewhere safe. You may not see them, they may not talk about it from the rooftops, but that doesn’t mean they’ve had everything easy.

2. You can never please everyone. No matter what you do, there will be people disapproving of your choices, despising you for your guts. And those are the ones you should ignore first.

3. There are some people you will instantly connect with. You’ll share the same joke and everything will just fit, no efforts required. And there will be those you just cannot get along with. Something would always be amiss. You’ll probably never understand what and why.

© Unsplash

4. People will judge you without knowing you. And you will do it to other people too, sometimes even with the best of intentions. Get over it. Nobody really knows anyone inside out.

5. People pull each other down because sometimes that’s the only way they can rise up.

6. Nobody really fits into ‘conventions’, if you think of it. Those ‘people’ we refuse to identify with actually don’t exist. Everybody’s constantly trying to break some stereotype or the other. Everybody’s trying to break out of their shell and accept who they truly are.

© Unsplash

7. People will be selfish no matter how good you’ve been to them. They may not even be around to justify it.

8. And you will break people’s trust too, sometimes, in ways you wouldn’t even know.

9. People are a result of their experiences, a consequence of everything they’ve seen and gone through. Everyone’s the way they are for a reason. To really get to know them, you’ve to listen to their story.

© Unsplash

10. Loving people for who they are is the most difficult thing in the world. It’s easier said than done. Everyone has their own share of flaws, flaws that may sometimes overpower them in entirety.

11. Some people can just look through you, break all walls you’ve built around yourself in just a moment, and reach the innermost corner of your soul. No matter how much you may pretend to be someone else, they’ll find a way in.

12. And sometimes, that’s the reason why you’d throw them out of your life the first. Because it may feel uncomfortable to share that little secret with someone you barely know.

© Unsplash

13. Everyone’s insecure in their own way. There’s something all of us yearn for, there’s something all of us are hiding from the world, something we all wanted but never got. And it’s comforting to know we’re all actually swimming in the same waters, it’s not just you.

14. People change. And not always for the good. You just gotta learn to live with it, or walk away.

15. Most people don’t know what they really believe in. They do what everybody’s doing because it’s convenient. It’s comfortable and safe to be a part of the herd. They don’t question their own beliefs. And that’s why they’re the happiest!

© Unsplash

16. Don’t go by what people say. You may take people’s appreciation or criticism to your heart often, but you must know that most of them don’t even mean what they say.

17. We often chase the people we think are ‘perfect for us’ but they’re almost always different from the ones that are right for us.

18. Each one of us is wearing a façade. Nobody is really like they appear to be. We’re all just waiting for someone we can blindly trust, someone who’d love us despite all our flaws.

© Unsplash

]]>We don’t really need to tell you about the benefits of healthy eating because we are sure you are aware of them. But sometimes it becomes difficult to maintain the healthy eating policy in office. The moment the clock strikes 4, we start getting hunger pangs and resort to the junk food available in the office cafeteria. Moreover, there can be too many tempting options available in office, but eating high calorie snacks and sugary drinks will make you feel sleepy and take your energy levels lower.

In fact, for all you guys who are into fitness, trust us eating the same kind of fruits everyday is very boring, and making extra meals for office early in the morning when you’re already rushing is out of question. So here’s the deal: make a smart choice with these super easy snacks for office that don’t even take much time.

1. Almonds And Peanuts

A handful of almonds or peanuts will not only keep you full but also provide the daily dose of protein you need. The only effort you need to make is pack it in an air-tight container. To make them more delicious you can roast them and sprinkle some salt and pepper on it.

© wikimedia

2. Sprouts

Sprouts are low in calories, high in fibre and protein and an excellent choice to munch on in between work. If your taste buds are always on the lookout for something chatpata, make a sprout salad with chopped onions, cucumber, tomatoes and green chillies.    

© wikimedia

3. Puffed Rice Or Rice Flakes

Who doesn’t like Bhel Puri or any other chaat made with puffed rice. If you are not a pro with bhel puri, just toss in some cucumber, tomatoes, roasted peanuts, green chillies, salt and you are good to go. Poha is another easy thing to make and if not that, then just get a packet of diet chidwa.

© wikimedia

4. Oats

Oats are really easy to make and we are not talking about those ready to eat oatmeal that are full of preservatives. All you need to do is cook oats in water or skimmed milk and it takes even less than 10 minutes to make it. Show off your culinary skills guys!    

© pixabay

5. Boiled Eggs

Boiled eggs are an excellent source of protein and possibly the first thing our gym trainer asks us to include in our diet. Boil extra eggs so that you can have some in the morning and leave some for the later part of the day. Though be a little conscious about the smell.

© flickr

6. Fruits

When we said that eating fruits everyday gets boring, we did not intend on eliminating them totally. You can change the fruits daily. For instance, frozen bananas on one day and maybe fruit cream on alternate days.  Even apples and peanut butter make a great combination.

© Thinkstock Photos/Getty Images

7. Club Sandwiches

We don’t expect you to make fancy grilled sandwiches. Just toast your bread, add some low fat butter or low fat cream, sliced cucumber and tomatoes and you’re done. If you have time, make some fresh orange or watermelon juice. You will not just save big bucks but will cut down on calories too.

© public domain pictures

8. Yogurt And Boiled Vegetables

Yogurt is great for our digestive system and is a good source of probiotics. To make your snack more delicious and nutritious, you can boil your favourite vegetables and mix them with an yogurt dressing.

© wikimedia

© Reuters

The Algerian, who just turned 25, has achieved what prodigal sons and immense talents fail to do after years. Following the firm footsteps of players like Mark Hughes, Thierry Henry, Alan Shearer, Cristiano Ronaldo, Robin Van Persie, Wayne Rooney and Gareth Bale, Riyad Mahrez found sublime form throughout the season scoring 25 goals and 29 assists. He, along with Jamie Vardy, played the pivotal role in securing the Premier League with two games to spare and gave a new dimension to his career.

Here is the delight of the season, the Algerian maestro with the trophy:

A day i Will Never Forget .. pic.twitter.com/FbQlM8UO9z

Mahrez was born to a French mother in France and an Algerian/Moroccan father who like Riyad was a footballer. The sudden demise of his father when he was aged 15 made him follow his father’s footsteps of becoming a professional footballer someday.

He started his career in France with Quimper Kerfeunteun FC in 2009 to 2010, followed by a stint at Le Havre for 2 years where he scored 24 goals for the French side. Le Havre was relegated the following season but Riyad Mahrez continued to be a part in their Ligue 2 campaign hardly gathering 6 goals in 60 appearances. 

The Lucky Break

While playing for Le Havre, the Leicester City scout Steve Walsh was monitoring Riyad’s teammate Ryan Mendes but was instead impressed by the Algerian. In January 2014, Riyad Mahrez signed a 3 and half year contract with Leicester City who were struggling in the second-tier Championship.

In the next few months, Mahrez had 4 substitute appearances in which he scored his first goal for Leicester and then scored an important 82nd minute equalizer against local rivals Nottingham Forest. Leicester eventually won the championship and regained their place in the English Premier League after 10 years.

The EPL Debut: Mahrez Has Arrived On The Main Stage

Riyad Mahrez made his EPL debut on 24th August, 2014 and scored his first goal in the English Premier League on 4th October, 2014 in a 2-2 draw against Burnley. He played a key role when Leicester won 7 consecutive games to keep them alive in the league and avoid relegation. 

Season 2015-2016

By luck or by fluke, Riyad Mahrez was ready for another season and signed a four-year contract in 2015 just before the season started. He scored twice in the season opener against Sunderland where Leicester won 4-2.

Wes Morgan, Leicester’s captain described Mahrez as ‘the team’s match winner’.

By November, Riyad Mahrez scored 7 goals in 10 games and then pumped in a hat-trick against Swansea City scoring all the 3 goals in a 3-0 win.

Such is the case that Riyad Mahrez’s transfer value increased from 4.5 million pounds to 35.1 million pounds in January, 2016.

© Reuters

The family which earlier hesitated on Mahrez’s decision of coming to England is now a happy unit post Leicester’s triumph. His son and wife celebrated the title win after Leicester won 3-1 against Everton and lifted the trophy.

© Reuters

]]>It’s an art to know your drink and hold it well. You know what else is an art? Knowing what certain alcohol-related terms mean, instead of ordering a drink because it sounds so complicated and smart while you end up feeling silly because it gave you a hit you didn’t see coming. Oh, well, the more you know. 

1. Apéritif 

© Fashion Beans

A small alcohol-based drink that is supposed to be consumed before a meal because of its appetite-stimulating properties. Basically, when you want a drink that will keep you hungry for the meal you’ll be ordering soon after, you order one from this selection. 

Examples of such drinks: Vermouth, Campari, Cynar, Dubonnet; Champagne, Sherry, Prosecco and Cava work just as well. 

2. Digestif  

© Alcademics

This is an alcoholic drink that can be consumed, either before, or after a meal; but, is meant to aid in your digestion of whatever food you will be, or have already eaten. Although, preferably, consume after the meal, since you’re going for an aperitif prior to it. 

Examples of such drinks: Brandy—Cognac, Armagnac, Port wines, Sherry, Whisky, Black Tequila, Jagermeister 

3. Muddled 

© Designsponge

This is when you order a drink that requires your bartender to crush the fruit or the herb so that the juice mixes well with the alcohol. You’ll notice the bartender reach for a pestle-like wooden crusher used to get the juice or essential oils out of the fruit or herb in your drink. It just helps to know this. 

Examples of such drinks: A Vodka Mojito, Spritzers, Brazilian Sangria, Black and Blue Caipiroska, Caipirinha 

4. Virgin 

© Sobeys

If you’re the designated driver of the group, you need to rote this term in your brain’s alcohol dictionary. Virgin means the same as ordering a mocktail. But, here’s the thing about mocktails—it’s for teenagers. You use the word virgin. For instance, you want a Virgin Mojito; or a Virgin Bloody Mary, or a Virgin Martini. It means sans the alcohol. Get it? 

Examples of such drinks: All mocktails are virgin drinks—Mojitos, Martinis, Bloody Mary 

5. Dirty 

© Liquor

This refers to an alcoholic drink, usually a cocktail in which the colour and taste is changed slightly by adding different ingredients to these. For instance, a Dirty Martini is all about adding bar olive juice so that the clarity is diluted and it tastes comparatively salty. Similarly, a Dirty Mojito is one in which you add gold rum, instead of white rum; thereby diluting the transparency of the drink. 

Examples of such drinks: Dirty Martini, Dirty Shirley, Dirty Mojito, Dirty Vodka Martini

6. Neat 

© Jim Beam

When you order a neat, you’re basically ordering an alcohol that is to be best consumed at room temperature, minus any add-ons. This means, you don’t add ice, or water, or any other mixture to this drink. Such drinks are usually meant to be sipped on slowly, to last you through most parts of your evening. 

Examples of such drinks: Vodka, Whisky, Bourbon, Gin

7. On The Rocks  

© Fashion Beans

Of course, you’ve heard about a whiskey… on the rocks, or a vodka on the rocks. Here’s what it means. Any drink served ‘On the rocks’ is poured out for you in a lowball glass, over a cluster of ice cubes which is from where the term gets its name. 

Examples of such drinks: Scotch, Prosecco, Whiskey, Vodka

8. Straight Up 

© Emerils Margarita

An alcoholic beverage that is served straight up usually lies somewhere between a ‘Neat’ and an ‘On the rocks’. Didn’t understand? This kind of a drink is usually shaken, or stirred up with ice, after which the ice is strained and the drink is served to you chilled. Suppose you go for a margarita, to this ice is added, shaken, or stirred—according to your preference—then, it is strained and served to you. You can try this with most cocktail options. 

Examples of such drinks: Martini, Margarita 

9. With A Twist 

© YouTube

Drinks that are served ‘with a twist’ have some kind of fruit that is either sliced, or cut up using what is known as a canella cutter. We usually assume the fruits are added as a decoration piece on the drink. However, the fruit adds a hint of flavour to whatever the drink is; and in most cases, the flavour is a contrast to the notes in the drink so it balances out the taste. Bet you didn’t know that, eh?! 

Examples of such drinks: Spritzers, Gin Martini, Horse’s Neck

]]>Our eyes twinkle almost instantly when we read the term ‘dream job’. We all have our set of notions attached with it and want to grab that dream job too. Be it friends, family or mentors, one question they will surely ask you is “What is your dream job?”

But what is a dream job? Is it one that pays you exceptionally well? Is it a job where you get creative freedom and do what you are passionate about? There are so many expectations related to a dream job that sometimes we just sit and think if we are doing anything productive in our career.

While you guys fantasize about dream jobs, let us bust some myths for you to give you a reality check.  

Myth: My Passion Will Pay For My Bills

Reality: Sorry to break your heart, but passion does not always pay well. Few months in the job and you might already be struggling to choose between luxury and necessity. However, this doesn’t mean you can’t do what you love. To achieve success it’s important to establish your work first.              

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Myth: I Will Be Happy Doing What I Love

Reality: There can’t be anyone who is completely happy and content with their work. It’s plain stupid to expect things to be perfect in your career. There will be days when you would hate your work. Sometimes your work will drive you crazy that you might even think of quitting.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Myth: Hard Work Will Get Me There

Reality: It sure will only to the extent where you don’t waste your efforts. The moment we hear any ‘rags to riches’ story, we start working our asses off towards it believing that we too will achieve success in future. But we forget that this might not even be our dream.  

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Myth: I Can Never Get Bored Of My Dream Job  

Reality: It’s good that you love what you do, but ask yourself if you would stay here forever! There will be a time when you will get tired or bored of what you are doing. You might be in the same field doing similar things but not the exact same thing. You would rather explore new avenues.

© Thinkstock/Getty Images

Myth: There Is No Such Thing As A Dream Job

Reality: Dream job is not a destination. You can work towards building your career or to become financially stable. All those count as a part of your bigger dream. So instead of drawing a negative picture of dream jobs, you can actually work towards achieving what you want.

© Shutterstock

So guys, we hope that you don’t get confused with the myths revolving around a perfect job or dream job. Also let us know if you have any other myths that you have come across in your career.

© TOI

But should gentlemen like these be ever compared with numbers?

Two players at any moment in their careers can never be compared with each other because they played under entirely different conditions, rules and strategies and with different teams. With the emergence of T20, the cricketing notions have completely transformed, with unexpectedly high scoring rates and stroke play.

© BCCL

Kohli mostly sticks to the manual and he is consistent without having to take too many risks, avoiding flamboyant air-borne strokes. Watching him sweep the bat off the grounds and playing those amazing cover drives does remind one of Sachin but that is where the comparison must end. This is Kohli’s format as much as Test Cricket was Sachin’s.

Sachin was more of a purist who considered batting an art and loved to express himself on the field with a plethora of shots in his armor. Therefore, comparing both Kohli and Sachin’s art-form is like comparing chalk and cheese which doesn’t make any sense, does it?

Kohli, in the end, will definitely break some of the records which Sachin made. It’s certain and in time it will happen. And till then it would be wise if we can just maintain some level of sanity and not feed these stats as some sort of biblical truth of what a past-master was or what a current young-ace is.
